title: When everything that defined you is shaken, who are you?
teaser: Your country, your job, your security—all unstable. So who are you, really?
framework: Matthew 6:33 - Seek first the kingdom... and all these things will be added

panels.heading: THE GROUND IS SHIFTING
panels.content:
Your country is fracturing. Political violence is at levels not seen since the 1970s. Democracy feels like it's unraveling—71% of people are dissatisfied with how it's working.

Your paycheck doesn't stretch anymore. Inflation has eaten 25% of your purchasing power since 2020. You're "job hugging"—staying in work you hate because the economy feels too unstable to risk a move.

Everything that once told you who you were—American, successful, secure—is shaking.

So when the labels fall away, who remains?

panels.heading: THE BORROWED IDENTITIES
panels.content:
You thought you knew who you were.

Your identity was built on what you achieved, what you earned, what country you belonged to. You were your résumé, your political affiliation, your net worth.

But those are costumes, not skin.

When institutions fail, your national identity feels hollow. When your job barely pays bills, your professional identity rings false. When your savings can't keep up with rent, your financial identity crumbles.

You've been building on sand. And now the tide is coming in.

panels.heading: THE COST OF UNSTABLE GROUND
panels.content:
The cost of tying your identity to things that shift is this: **constant anxiety.**

43% of adults are more anxious than they were last year. You're trying to hold onto definitions that keep slipping through your fingers.

You refresh the news obsessively, checking if your world is still intact. You check your bank account daily, calculating if you can survive another month. You argue politics online, desperate to prove your side is right—because if it's not, who are you?

This is what happens when your identity is borrowed, not given.

When what you're standing on shakes, everything shakes.

panels.heading: AN ANCIENT QUESTION
panels.content:
There's an ancient text that speaks to this.

2,000 years ago, a carpenter-turned-teacher asked his followers a question in a moment of chaos. The political regime was violent. The religious establishment was corrupt. The economy exploited the poor.

Sound familiar?

In the middle of that mess, Jesus asked them:

**"Who do people say I am?"**

They gave him the labels—prophet, revolutionary, teacher.

Then he asked the real question:

**"But who do YOU say I am?"**

Not the crowd. Not the culture. You.

panels.heading: THE UNSHAKEABLE ANSWER
panels.content:
One of his followers, Peter, answered:

**"You are the Christ, the Son of the living God."**

And Jesus said something striking:

**"Blessed are you... for this was not revealed to you by flesh and blood, but by my Father in heaven."**

In other words: Your identity doesn't come from what the world tells you. It comes from what God reveals.

When everything around you shakes, this remains:

**You are known by God. You are loved by God.**

That's the identity that doesn't collapse.

panels.heading: THE INVITATION
panels.content:
God,

When everything shakes—my country, my security, my sense of self—you remain.

I've been clinging to labels that fail. Identities that fracture under pressure.

Teach me who I am when the costumes are stripped away. Not my politics. Not my productivity. Not my net worth.

Reveal to me the identity that doesn't collapse.

The one you've known all along.

Amen.
